begin() - Method in class timing.TimingController
Implementation of TimingTarget.begin.
begin() - Method in interface timing.TimingTarget
This method is called when the timer first starts.

C

Cycle - Class in timing
 
Cycle(int, int) - Constructor for class timing.Cycle
Constructs the Cycle object for use in creating a TimingController object.

E

end() - Method in class timing.TimingController
Implementation of TimingTarget.end.
end() - Method in interface timing.TimingTarget
This method is called when the timer ends, either due to the timing sequence ending naturally or due to a call to TimingController.stop().
Envelope - Class in timing
 
Envelope(double, int, Envelope.RepeatBehavior, Envelope.EndBehavior) - Constructor for class timing.Envelope
Constructs the Envelope object for use in creating a TimingController object.
Envelope.EndBehavior - Enum in timing
EndBehavior determines what happens at the end of the Envelope.
Envelope.RepeatBehavior - Enum in timing
RepeatBehavior determines how each successive cycle will flow.

I

INFINITE - Static variable in class timing.TimingController
Used to specify indefinite Cycle duration or Envelope repeatCount
isRunning() - Method in class timing.TimingController
Returns whether this TimingController object is currently running

S

start() - Method in class timing.TimingController
The constructor sets up everything, but start must be called to actually start the timer.
stop() - Method in class timing.TimingController
This method is optional; animations will always stop on their own if TimingController is provided with appropriate values for duration and repeatCount in the constructor.

T

timing - package timing
 
TimingController - Class in timing
TimingController
TimingController(Cycle, Envelope) - Constructor for class timing.TimingController
Constructor: sets up all necessary information
TimingController(Cycle, Envelope, TimingTarget) - Constructor for class timing.TimingController
Constructor: sets up all necessary information
TimingController(int, TimingTarget) - Constructor for class timing.TimingController
Constructor: this is a utility method that sets up reasonable defaults for a simple timing sequence that will have no delay, will not repeat, will hold the end value when it ends, will use a timer resolution of 30 milliseconds, and will run for the length of time specified in the duration parameter.
timingEvent(long, long, float) - Method in class timing.TimingController
There are two ways to receive timing events: either override this method in a subclass of TimingController or create a TimingController instance directly with a TimingTarget object.
timingEvent(long, long, float) - Method in interface timing.TimingTarget
Implementors will override this method and pass the TimingTarget into the TimingController constructor in order to receive timing events.
TimingTarget - Interface in timing
TimingTarget

values() - Static method in enum timing.Envelope.RepeatBehavior
Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they're declared.
